DataElement.preferredName: Analgesic Quantification Algorithm Score 8 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The range of numeric values measuring the use of opioids that alleviate pain without loss of consciousness.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An algorithm designed to categorize analgesic medication use, and capture changes in the dosing, frequency, and/or type of analgesic medications administered._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An algorithm designed to categorize analgesic medication use, and capture changes in the dosing, frequency, and/or type of analgesic medications administered.

Concepts.definition: An algorithm designed to categorize  analgesic medication use, and capture changes in the dosing, frequency, and/or type of analgesic medications administered.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An algorithm designed to categorize analgesic medication use, and capture changes in the dosing, frequency, and/or type of analgesic medications administered._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Strong Opioids Greater than 600 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Strong Opioids Greater than 600 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at greater than 600 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.

Concepts.longName: Strong Opioids Greater than 600 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day
Concepts.definition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at greater than 600 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Strong Opioids Greater than 300-600 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Strong Opioids Greater than 300-600 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at greater than 300 mg to a maximum of 600 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.

Concepts.longName: Strong Opioids Greater than 300-600 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day
Concepts.definition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at greater than 300 mg to a maximum of 600 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Strong Opioids Greater than 150-300 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at greater than 150 mg to a maximum of 300 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.

Concepts.longName: Strong Opioids Greater than 150-300 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day
Concepts.definition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at greater than 150 mg to a maximum of 300 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Strong Opioids Greater than 75-150 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Strong Opioids Greater than 75-150 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at greater than 75 mg to a maximum of 150 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.

Concepts.definition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at greater than 75 mg to a maximum of 150 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Strong Opioids Less than or Equal to 75 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Strong Opioids Less than or Equal to 75 mg Oral Morphine Equivalent per Day
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at less than or equal to 75 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.

Concepts.definition: A response that indicates the patient used strong opioids at less than or equal to 75 mg oral morphine equivalents (OME) per day.
